text: The Traditional Unionist Voice (TUV) is a small unionist political party based in Northern Ireland.TUV. Politics.co.uk. Retrieved 2 October 2017. They are right-wing, supporting conservative values. They also think that Northern Ireland should stay in the United Kingdom. Their leader, Jim Allister, is the only member of the party in the Northern Ireland Assembly. The party was created by former members of the Democratic Unionist Party in 2007. It has one MP in the House of Commons of the United Kingdom. ==References== Category:Political parties in Northern Ireland
title: Traditional Unionist Voice
